result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney waives reading of complaint. Defendant is informed of charges. Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint.
Defendant informed of charges and penalties. 
Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights. 
22CF543 Ct 1: Defendant enters no contest plea.
22CF162 Ct 1  Defendant enters no contest plea.
22CF162 CT 3: Defendant enters no contest plea.
Factual basis and probable cause found. 
Court accepts pleas as voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently made and finds defendant guilty. 

Other counts and other cases in their entirety DRI: 22CF228, 22CF329, 22CF327, 22CF359, 22CF354, 22CM44, 22CF227

11:48 AM Prosecuting attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant MARIE DANIELLE DANIELSON in court.  Attorney David W. Field in court for MARIE DANIELLE DANIELSON. 
Uncharged matter tracking. 
Court orders defendant to sign amended bond at the Clerk of Courts. 
Court orders defendant to become compliant with pretrial monitoring. 
Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Review hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

BOND COVERS 22CF162, 22CF227, 22CF228, 22CF327, 22CF329, 22CF354, 22CF359, 22CM44
Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
Defendant shall not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. 
Defendant shall not to possess syringes unless medically required. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume illegal drugs / any prescription drugs not prescribed. 
No verbal or physical abuse of anyone. 
No contact with Victim 1 or Victim 1's residence.
Defendant to have one-time access to property to retrieve personal belongings, to be coordinated through Crime/Victim Witness services.

9:01 AM Defendant MARIE DANIELLE DANIELSON in court.  Attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney David W. Field in court for MARIE DANIELLE DANIELSON. 
22CF162, 22CF227, 22CF228, 22CF327, 22CF329, 22CF354, 22CF359, 22CM44
Defendant has two bonds co-existing.
Attorney Field requests defendant have access to property to retrieve personal belongings.
Victim speaks.
Court amends bond with conditions to allow defendant to have one-time access to property to retrieve personal belongings, to be coordinated through Crime/Victim Witness services.
Request for no contact with victim to be dropped.
Attorney Gay addresses the Court.
Court denies request, but will entertain if all information received showing proper channels followed 
Court amends bond in all cases to be consistent with 22CF359 6-17-2022 amended bond with the above modification.  
Bond continues.
Review hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
